sen.j: 田中 好（たなか よしみ、1886年12月 - 1956年11月14日）は、京都府船井郡（後の園部町城南町、現在の南丹市園部町城南町）生まれの元政治家（衆議院議員）。
sen.e: Yoshimi TANAKA (December 1886 - November 14, 1956) was a politician (House of Representatives) who was born in Funai County, Kyoto Prefecture (later Jonanmachi, Sonobe Town and Jonanmachi, Sonobe Town Nantan City of today)

Yoshimi TANAKA (December 1886 - November 14, 1956) was a politician (House of Representatives) who was born in Funai County, Kyoto Prefecture (later Jonanmachi, Sonobe Town and now Jonanmachi, Sonobe Town, Nantan City)

Yoshimi TANAKA (December 1886 - November 14, 1956) was a politician (House of Representatives) who was born in Funai County, Kyoto Prefecture (later Jonan-machi, Sonobe Town and now Jonan-machi, Sonobe Town, Nantan City)

sen.j: 日本道路協会理事、治水砂防協会監事、衆議院商工厚生常任委員長、厚生委員会委員長などを歴任。
sen.e: He held posts such as Director of the Japan Road Association, Controller of Japan Sabo Association, Chairman of the Commerce and Welfare Standing Committee and the Health and Welfare Committee.

He held posts such as Director of the Japan Road Association, Controller of Japan Sabo Association, Chairman of the Commerce and Welfare Standing Committee and Chairman of the Health and Welfare Committee.

He held posts such as Director of the Japan Road Association, Controller of Japan Sabo Association, Chairman of the Commerce and Welfare Standing Committee and Chairman of the Health and Welfare Committee.

sen.j: 立命館大学卒業後、京都府、兵庫県庁勤務を経て内務省に入省。
sen.e: After graduating from Ritsumeikan University, he worked for the Hyogo Prefectural Office and then joined the Department of the Interior.
After graduating from Ritsumeikan University, he worked for the Hyogo Prefectural Office and then joined the Department of the Interior.
After graduating from Ritsumeikan University, he worked for the Kyoto Prefectural Office and Hyogo Prefectural Office and then joined the Department of the Interior.
sen.cmt: 京都府 を追加しました。

sen.j: その後、鉄道省に移るも一貫して道路・交通・治水行政に従事。
sen.e: Later, he transferred to the Ministry of Railways, but consistently engaged in road, transportation and river improvement administration.
Later, he transferred to the Ministry of Railways, but consistently engaged in road, transportation, and river improvement administration.
Later, he transferred to the Ministry of Railways, but consistently engaged in road, transportation, and river improvement administration.

sen.j: 戦後日本の道路法を作った男として知られる。
sen.e: He is known as the man who created Road Act after the end of the war.
He is known as the man who created the Road Act after the end of the war.
He is known as the man who created the Road Act after the end of the war.

sen.j: 1936年には第19回衆議院議員総選挙に立候補し初当選。
sen.e: In 1936, he ran in the 19th election of the House of Representatives and was elected for the first time.
In 1936, he ran in the 19th election of the House of Representatives and was elected for the first time.
In 1936, he ran in the 19th election of the House of Representatives and was elected for the first time.

sen.j: その後も戦前2回（京都府第2区）、戦後1回（京都2区）、計4期に渡り国政に携わるなど活躍。
sen.e: Thereafter, he served two terms before the war (Kyoto District 2), and once after the war (Kyoto District 2) and was involved in national politics for four terms.
Thereafter, he served two terms before the war (Kyoto District 2), and once after the war (Kyoto District 2) and was involved in national politics for four terms.
Thereafter, he served two terms before the war (Kyoto District 2), and once after the war (Kyoto District 2) and was involved in national politics for four terms.

sen.j: とりわけ1953年の第26回衆議院議員総選挙では、当時園部町議会議員兼議員秘書だった野中広務の奔走もあって芦田均（元首相）、前尾繁三郎（元衆議院議長）らを抑えトップ当選を果たしている。
sen.e: Particularly in the 26th House of Representative election in 1953, he won by landslide against Hitoshi ASHIDA (former Prime Minister) and Shigezaburo MAEO (former House of Representative chairman) from the strong push from Hiromu NONAKA who was SonobeTown Council and secretary to the member of the House at the time.

Particularly in the 26th House of Representative election in 1953, he won by landslide against Hitoshi ASHIDA (former Prime Minister) and Shigezaburo MAEO (former House of Representatives chairman) from a strong push from Hiromu NONAKA who was a member of the Sonobe Town Council and secretary to the member of the House at the time.

Particularly in the 26th House of Representative election in 1953, he won by landslide against Hitoshi ASHIDA (former Prime Minister) and Shigezaburo MAEO (former House of Representatives chairman) from a strong push from Hiromu NONAKA who was a member of the Sonobe Town Council and secretary to the member of the House at the time.

sen.j: 衆議院商工厚生常任委員長、厚生委員会委員長などを歴任。
sen.e: He served as the chairperson of Commerce and Welfare standing committee and chairperson of the Health and Welfare committee.
He served as the chairperson of Commerce and Welfare standing committee and chairperson of the Health and Welfare committee.
He served as the chairperson of Commerce and Welfare Standing Committee and chairperson of the Health and Welfare Committee.

sen.j: 党内では旧自由党系として岸派に属した。
sen.e: In the party, he belonged to the Kishi faction.
Within the party, he belonged to the Kishi faction.
Within the party, he belonged to the Kishi faction.

sen.j: また、難所とされた国道9号老ノ坂峠の整備などにも尽力した。
sen.e: He exerted efforts to get National Route 9 built through the Oinosaka Pass, which was a difficult location to build a road.
He exerted efforts to get National Route 9 built through the Oinosaka Pass, which was a difficult location to build a road.
He exerted efforts to get National Route 9 built through the Oinosaka-toge Pass, which was a difficult location to build a road.

sen.j: 1964年5月14日、その功績を讃える「頌徳碑」が観音峠隧道南側に建立された。
sen.e: On May 14, 1965, "Shotokuhi" (a monument which praises one's high virtue) was dedicated at the southern side of the Kannon Pass Tunnel in recognition of his great achievement.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On May 14, 1965, "Shotokuhi" (a monument which praises one's high virtue) was dedicated at the southern side of the Kannon Pass Tunnel in recognition of his great achievement.
On May 14, 1964, 'Shotokuhi' (a monument which praises one's high virtue) was dedicated at the southern side of the Kannon-toge Mountain pass tunnel in recognition of his great achievement.
sen.cmt: Kannon-toge Mountain pass tunnel としました。1964に修正しました。

sen.j: その後、園部城跡近くの小向山の山頂に移設された。
sen.e: The monument was later transferred to the top of the Komukai-yama (Obuke-zan) Mountain near the ruins of Sonobe-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処小向山→[読み方不明]
sen.e: The monument was later transferred to the top of Komukai-yama (Obuke-zan) Mountain near the ruins of Sonobe-jo Castle.
The monument was later transferred to the top of Mt. Komukai (Obuke-zan) near the ruins of Sonobe-jo Castle.

sen.j: 碑は岸信介（元首相）が揮毫。
sen.e: The inscription on the monument is done in ex-Prime Minister Nobusuke KISHI's handwriting.
The inscription on the monument is done in ex-Prime Minister Nobusuke KISHI's handwriting.
The inscription on the monument is done in ex-Prime Minister Nobusuke KISHI's handwriting.

sen.j: 「頌徳碑建設委員会 農林大臣 赤城宗徳」の名前で、碑文が刻まれている。
sen.e: The author of epigraph was inscribed as "Munenori AKAGI, Minister of Agriculture and Forestry, Shotokuhi Construction Committee"
The author of the epigraph was inscribed as "Munenori AKAGI, Minister of Agriculture and Forestry, Shotokuhi Construction Committee"
The author of the epigraph was inscribed as 'Munenori AKAGI, Minister of Agriculture and Forestry, Shotokuhi Construction Committee.'

sen.j: 資料･田中好頌徳碑
sen.e: Reference: Yoshimi TANAKA Shotokuhi
Reference: Yoshimi TANAKA Shotokuhi
Reference: Yoshimi TANAKA Shotokuhi

sen.j: 『田中好先生は明治十九年 京都府園部町に生まれた
sen.e: Yoshimi Tanaka was born 1886 in Sonobe Town, Kyoto. He graduated from Ritsumeikan University and served in the Department of Interior, as the Ministry of Railways in Kyoto and Hyogo. In 1936, he was elected to the House of Representatives from Kyoto District 2 and served 4 terms. During his tenure, he held the post of chairperson of the Commerce and Welfare standing committee and many other posts. He was involved in may huge projects, particularly in the field of road, transportation and river improvement. The construction of National Route 5 through the Oinosaka Pass and the renovation of Hankaku Road in Tamba are two of the many projects he was involved in.
sen.cmt: 碑文は一原多訳文です。
sen.e: Yoshimi Tanaka was born 1886 in Sonobe Town, Kyoto. He graduated from Ritsumeikan University and served in the Department of Interior, as the Ministry of Railways in Kyoto and Hyogo. In 1936, he was elected to the House of Representatives from Kyoto District 2 and served 4 terms. During his tenure, he held the post of chairperson of the Commerce and Welfare standing committee and many other posts. He was involved in many huge projects, particularly in the field of road, transportation, and river improvement. The construction of National Route 9 through the Oinosaka Pass and the renovation of Hankaku Road in Tamba are two of the many projects he was involved in.
Yoshimi Tanaka was born 1886 in Sonobe Town, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Standing Committee, Oinosaka-toge Pass としました。一原文一訳文の例外処理碑文なので「。」はつけていません。文末は変更しました。

sen.j: 立命館大学を卒え 京都府 兵庫県 内務省鉄道省に勤務
sen.e: He graduated from Ritsumeikan University and served in the Department of Interior, as the Ministry of Railways in Kyoto and Hyogo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理碑文なので「。」はつけていません。

sen.j: 昭和十一年京都府第二区で衆議院議員に当選 以来回を重ねること四回
sen.e: In 1936, he was elected to the House of Representatives from Kyoto District 2 and served 4 terms.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理碑文なので「。」はつけていません。

sen.j: 其間衆議院商工厚生常任委員長を始め多くの役職を歴任した
sen.e: During his tenure, he held the post of chairperson of the Commerce and Welfare Standing Committee and many other posts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理碑文なので「。」はつけていません。文末は変更しました。

sen.j: 我国発展の上に偉大な事業を致され、わけても道路交通治水関係に於いて不滅の業績を残されました
sen.e: He was involved in many huge projects, particularly in the field of road, transportation, and river improvement.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理碑文なので「。」はつけていません。

sen.j: 殊に郷土丹波では国道九号線老ノ坂並びに阪鶴道路の改修舗装等普く土木行政に尽くされた功績は枚挙に暇ありません』
sen.e: The construction of National Route 9 through the Oinosaka-toge Pass and the renovation of Hankaku Road in Tanba are two of the many projects he was involved in.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理碑文なので「。」はつけていません。
